DOC.brief_summary: This research do compare physical quality life benefit two different type exercise- tai chi versus strength training- female cancer survivor chemotherapy . Each exercise- tai chi strength training- compare participant group perform flexibility relaxation exercise , expect different benefit either tai chi strength training .
DOC.brief_title: Group Exercise Training Functional Improvement After Treatment ( The GET FIT Trial )
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Compare relative efficacy tai chi strength training prevent fall female cancer survivor . II . Determine mechanism tai chi strength training reduces risk fall . III . Determine well benefit intervention persist structure training stop . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Quantify compare relative efficacy tai chi resistance exercise biomarkers common cancer progression cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) woman cancer survivor . ( Optional ancillary study ) II . Quantify compare relative efficacy tai chi resistance exercise biomarkers unique CVD woman cancer survivor . ( Optional ancillary study ) III . Determine influence initial change adiposity change biomarkers exercise . ( Optional ancillary study ) IV . Explore effect exercise train biomarker accelerate age woman cancer survivor . ( Optional ancillary study ) OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 3 treatment arm . ARM I : Patients attend strength training class 1 hour 2 day per week . ARM II : Patients attend tai chi class 1 hour 2 day per week . ARM III : Patients attend supervise stretch relaxation class 1 hour 2 day per week . In arm , treatment continue 6 month . After completion study treatment , patient follow 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed stage IIII cancer cancer brain spinal cord ( confirm patient selfreport Health History Questionnaire ; patient unable confirm either site cancer stage cancer < stage IV , send letter physician confirm criterion ) Completed chemotherapy > 3 month prior enrollment concurrent adjuvant therapy hormone manipulation therapy breast cancer ( confirm patient selfreport Health History Questionnaire ; patient unable confirm whether complete chemotherapy 3 month prior enrollment , send letter physician confirm eligibility criterion ) Postmenopausal ( confirm selfreport Health History Questionnaire ; menopausal status could also confirm recent [ < 6 month enrollment ] laboratory report document serum folliclestimulating hormone [ FSH ] > 30 mIU/ml and/or serum estradiol < 30 pg/ml ) Currently underactive ( < 60 minute moderate intensity exercise per week last month ) ( confirm selfreport Health History Questionnaire ) Cognitive difficulty preclude answer survey question , participate exercise class performance test , provide inform consent ( confirm professional opinion Principal Investigator , Dr. Kerri WintersStone ) A medical condition , movement neurological disorder , medication use contraindicate participation moderate intensity exercise ( confirm selfreport Health History Questionnaire , physician clearance ; professional opinion Principal Investigator , Dr. Kerri WintersStone , contraindication identify patient physician present , may consider participant ineligible )
